column5: Salmusk. Musky/salmon. Loooong runs due to elevated stamina. Eats Brookies all day long.
I came here to say this very thing.

Smalleye....yes that's a good one.  Now imagine "brooskies"!  Both fish are very agressive however brook trout are much more agressive.  Brook trout live in cool clean water and taste great.  Musky get very large.  Both fish jump and both look great.  Also, brooskies has the same name as "brewskies" which is another favourite among fishermen.
A walleye without gills....
Nice, Very nice.
I'm good with that Bernie.  Pretty tough to argue with the brook trout. Mother nature did a fine job there.
Walleye.... There great just the way they are...
You and Stoty got it down!
A Salmerch.... Size strength and fighting ability of a King Salmon with the taste, breeding/growth and biting rate of perch.  World who cares I would be Salmerch fishing...

Im going to join in and say I agree with Brook Trout being some of mother natures best work. If only they could be caught in huge numbers in larger sizes....wait a second they do...Arctic Char is as close as you can get without a science lab!  But since we are playing Dr Frankestein,  Im going to take the airborne ability and strength of the Tarpon along with the dental work of a goliath Tigerfish. You guys seen these things????
The Brown Trout.  as beautiful and majestic as the brookie, but they get 30lbs.
Yaaa; they are nice. But, you really can't compare their colouring to that of a brook trout.
Bluegill/carp...Can you just imagine the fight from a ten-pounder...?
I'm going to have to go with mermaid. Hopefully they don't put up a good fight. And it would make long trips more enjoyable
:clapping:

Ok, so here goes this should be interesting... Take any two fish and combine them to make a super fish... for eating, catching whatever...  Rules.  1) 2 Fish 2) Can't combine salt, salt with fresh or brackish etc.. so No Great White Crappie, or Flying Muskie 3) You have to explain what traits you would want to be in the final fish 4) You can submit one ontario only strain coontaining ontario fish and one worldy fish containing any fish from around the world  I'll start... Ontario - Crapski I am thinking Crappie and Muskie... Taste, reproduction rate and schooling characteristics of Crappie, Muskie for the size and fighting ability.  World - Salmark I am thinking a Great White and a Pacific Salmon. Size, Power looks of the shark, mixed with the breeding habbits of a Salmon... Imagine watching a school of them jump up a river during spawning season.   Wow am I bored with no hockey and its not even october.
I think your Dr will suggest the closet pier and some glow spoons.  Please make an appointment ASAP!
never really fish from shore and just fished my last bass tournie.. weekends are booked up with kid stuff and hunting til the water freezes.

Alright, here it goes,  Ontario:  Surora trout, the common sunfish combined with the strength and beauty of the aurora trout.  World:  Borpon, A bonefish mixed with a tarpon, the raw fighting power and beauty of bonefish with the size of tarpon, Can you imagine seeing giant fins rising in 7ft of water?!  And yes I second Bill's prescription...
Muskhead  The Size and strength of Muskie mixed with the Snakeheads ability to leave the water and hunt you down   !!!!!
Maybe then people would stop wasting their time hunting deer and birds and instead have a worthy adversary!
Smalleye....
The perfect fish already exists. The Brook Trout. Mother natures finest work.
Imagine a school of muskie under the ice like cisco? Now that would be scary.
Ontario:  Percherel - Proliferaton of perch with the size (and taste!) of walleye.  World - haven't much experience with salt water species, I'll have even less if the Percherel ever happens  Michael
I've gotta agree with Dan.
The Drumrel. Drum and pickerel.  Wait for it................

What more do you want from a fresh water species? Good table fare. Great fighters. They only live in the most perfect, unpolluted places on the planet. And can a fish get any better looking than this? I think not.
Easy ............................Rock Bass and peacock bass......crazy aggresive and breaks your rods and still looks pretty!
What if it was 65 pounds? Haha, btw spec's are one of my favorites too. Lac beauchine is on my bucket list for a spec trip.
Carpski (carp, muskie)and GreatWhiteBut (Great White Shark, Halibut)
I'm in total agreement. Close the thread.

Not to fermilliar of fish of the world so I'll do two Ontario fish.  Pumpkineye. (Size and taste of walleye with the breeding speed and willingness to strike anything of pumpkinseed sunfish)  Round Gobass (Imagine if we actually wanted to catch and eat em? Take the diet of the smallmouth bass and the insane breeding speed of round goby)
Large Mouth Sturgeon  Fighting ability and size of a sturgeon with Large mouth reproduction and growth rate, eating and living habits.  Imagine pitching under a tree branch for one of those
Freshwater: Peacock x Bowfin Saltwater: Tarpon x Bonefish and have it look like a Snook lol
Tuna (SUPER fast and strong, giant size, tastes great) and Mako shark (jump, jump, jump, jump, jump, jump.....jump again)
Smallmouth carp - The size and speed of the common carp with the acrobatic qualities of the smallmouth bass.
Nope, you really can't get any better!
Word !!!!!!!!! Brook Trout and I are about to meet in 3 days time....eeeeeeehaaaa!!!

How about a blueski the size, power and fight of a blue catfish and the aggressiveness of a Muskie.... Imagine a 2-300lbs monster lurking around!  And for a salty.... Whale tuna.... Whale shark and a blue fin tuna ... That would cure the hunger in Africa!
